Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam

Official Poster Directed by Paul Hoen Produced by Kevin Lafferty Written by Daniel Berendsen

Karin Gist

Regina Y. Hicks Starring Demi Lovato

Joe Jonas

Meaghan Jette Martin

Nick Jonas

Kevin Jonas

Alyson Stoner Studio Disney Channel Distributed by Disney Channel Release date(s) Summer 2010 Country United States

Canada Language English Preceded by Camp Rock

Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam is the sequel to the Disney Channel Original Movie, Camp Rock. The movie was filmed all around Ontario, Canada[1]. Production on the film began on September 3, 2009 and wrapped on October 16th, 2009.[2] It is scheduled to premiere summer 2010.[3][4]

Contents

[hide]

1 Plot

2 Cast

3 Promotion

4 References

[edit] Plot

This sequel to the popular Camp Rock movie storyline follows Mitchie, Shane, Jason, Nate and their friends as they return to Camp Rock for another great summer of music and fun. However they soon learn that a new state-of-the-art music/performance camp, Camp Star, has opened across the lake and has lured away many of Camp Rock instructors and campers -- putting the future of Camp Rock in jeopardy.

And when Camp Star's hotshot performer, Luke Williams (Matthew Finley), challenges Camp Rock to a musical showdown to see which camp really has the stronger musical talent, everyone prepares for the ultimate battle of the bands. Meanwhile, in a classic "Romeo and Juliet" twist, Nate falls for the daughter of the owner of the rival camp.[5] [6]

[edit] Cast

Demi Lovato as Mitchie Torres

Joe Jonas as Shane Gray

Kevin Jonas as Jason

Nick Jonas as Nate

Meaghan Jette Martin as Tess Tyler

Alyson Stoner as Caitlyn Gellar

Anna Maria Perez de Tagl as Ella Pador

Jasmine Richards as Margaret "Peggy" Dupree[7]

Maria Canals Barrera as Connie Torres

Roshon Fegan as Sander Lawer

Matthew Finley as Luke Williams

Chloe Bridges as Dana Turner

Daniel Fathers as Brown Cesario
